Github

This game was finished and published on May 15th after being produced over the span of a single month. The focus for the project was to utilize ESC "Unity's Entity System" in production of a game. Since release the game has recieved very positive feedback on steam and was showcased by me at the 2024 "Linkedin-Bar Decade Party" as part of the "Indie Game Dungeon".

Dots Interactions -> Tldr

After retrieving the Input from the ActionMap a spherecast is used on both the entity's and the mouse position to detect overlapping collisions. The objects overlapping with the mouse gains the "Scale Effect" component causing them to react after hovering.

Analysis

I created this game with the sole purpose of learning to work with DOTS/ESC within a span of 3 weeks. The game was then integrated with Steamworks and published on Steam within one month from the start of the project. Reflecting on this experience, I realized that I learned much more than I initially anticipated. However, the two biggest takeaways and the ones I feel like I have become very good at is how to scope a project effectively and how to finish and deliver it within the given deadline.

Indie Game Dungeon Showcase

I showcased Honker at the "LinkedIn-Bar" together with the "Indie Game Dungeon." This was an incredible step in my journey due to the immense feedback (both positive and negative) I received from such a variety of experienced and talented individuals.
